file_content.text: Our triumph will be the stuff of legends.
You return triumphant! You have fought and bled alongside my legionnaires, and I welcome you back as one of our own.
It was an honor to fight alongside your men, Colonel.
Thank you.
The honor was entirely ours.
Let's just discuss the reward that Lieutenant Trell mentioned.
Skip to the reward.
Destroying the Republic's hidden fleet, defeating Major Kamden and ransacking his base--my master was extremely impressed.
My lord was impressed. Neither his praise nor his rewards come lightly.
Revel in the rewards of Lord Vago, and know that you will always be welcome among the ranks of the Seventy-fifth.
Continue your excellent service to the Empire.
Very good.
With pleasure. Farewell.
I'll keep that in mind if I ever need a few hundred extra guns.
Good to know.
I expect a call the next time you're on leave.
[Flirt] Stay in touch.
I shall keep that in mind. Farewell.
So long, then.
Farewell.
That's... really great. I'll just be going, now.
Um... okay.
I have no interest in being mistaken for one of you idiots.
You're all insane.
You spit on our praise? So be it. Take your reward and go.
My master awaits. Go, and serve with honor.
Hold a moment, please. Colonel Surab--commander, Seventy-fifth Legion.
Honor me with your time, my lord, and I will honor you in turn with a unique invitation from the incomparable Lord Vago.
Thanks to his unparalleled intellect, my master has uncovered a dangerous Republic plot unfolding as we speak. He has deemed you worthy of joining us in destroying them.
Your lord judges well--I've yet to meet a Republic plot I couldn't uproot.
Then your master is wise.
Word of my power is spreading.
Excellent.
Lord Vago is well informed. He knows precisely who can be relied upon.
Sith aren't the only ones who can bust Republic heads.
Looking for more?
Note this moment, agent: Today, you are honored by an invitation into the service of the mighty Lord Vago.
The Republic schemes against us as we speak. But my lord has foreseen their intentions, and he believes your organization's skills would be helpful in obliterating them.
If your master wants real results, he should hire a professional.
Trust me, I'm a better choice.
My lord knows your achievements well, hunter. If you choose to assist us, you will be welcome.
With respect, matters like this are best handled by Intelligence alone.
Leave this to Intelligence.
My master discovered this plot--no one else. Our troops are already deployed. You will share in our glory, or someone else will.
You've been chosen to receive an invitation from the infinitely wise Lord Vago--a rare honor for mere men and women like us.
My lord has uncovered a Republic plot that threatens our great work here. You have been judged worthy of employment toward these schemers' obliteration.
Surely your lord would prefer the strength of a fellow Sith in this matter?
I'm a better choice.
Hidden schemes? Obliteration? Can I come?
Sounds intriguing.
My master knows of your accomplishments. We would welcome your assistance.
I hope your master has deep pockets, because I don't come cheap.
"Worthy" isn't the half of it.
Of course. Lord Vago is as generous as he is powerful.
This sounds like an Intelligence matter to me.
I should be involved.
The assistance of an Intelligence agent would be welcome.
Keep talking.
I have more important concerns than your master's opinion.
I couldn't care less.
Perhaps, but none more important than stopping the Republic's plans.
You fought for Darth Gravus and saw the Republic's pathetic "reconstruction." It shows nothing of the tremendous resources they received.
You've seen the Republic's pitiful reconstruction efforts firsthand. They accomplished practically nothing, despite the tremendous resources they received.
My master determined that the Republic used those resources not only for rebuilding, but to construct a secret weapon. And my master is never wrong.
The Republic can build whatever they like--we will still crush them.
Then we will destroy it.
But we must find them, first.
A project like that must have had witnesses, and I'm very good at extracting information....
Round up enemies to question.
My master suggested interrogations as well, but we've yet to find anyone with useful information. Our enemies have been very careful indeed.
Track the materials, find what they're building, smash it. Easy.
Simple seek-and-destroy job.
If our enemies' secrets were easy to find, we wouldn't require your help.
If even a fraction of those resources were used, the weapon could be substantial.
A grave threat.
Precisely. It could even be a host of weapons.
Your master is lucky to have such a loyal servant.
[Flirt] You're very dedicated.
Perhaps when you've accomplished as much as he has, you'll draw such loyalty.
What do you need me for?
Why come to me?
What do you need me for?
Our legion serves gladly, but the situation requires specialists.
I'm not convinced.
The Republic has taken great pains to hide those materials. Their obvious intent is to use them against us.
Lord Vago determined the focus of the Republic's efforts prior to the invasion. We were deployed to search the area.
Elite enemy commandos attacked us on arrival. We will find the Republic's secret there--with your help.
Show me where they're hiding, and I'll flush them out.
Then let's get started.
Unless you're mistaken....
Lord Vago does not make mistakes.
A speeder will take you to legion base camp, where Lord Vago directs our operations.
My master will show you the beauty of his vision, and you will join our legion in honor and victory!
Perfect.
Nothing will stand against me.
Okay, crazy lady.
This is bunk. [Refuse quest]
You do not know the opportunity, the gift you dismiss. Perhaps someday you will.
Taris will soon be ours.
